test.description: ls: file using absolute path
ls: file using relative path
ls: files using globbing
ls: directory using absolute path
ls: directory using relative path
ls: directory using globbing
ls: file/directory that does not exist in /
ls: file/directory that does not exist in home directory (/user/username)
ls: Non-URI input file at Namenode's path

ls: dir at hdfs:// path

ls: non-existent file/directory in Namenode's path
ls: whitespaces in an absolute path to a file

test-commands.command: -fs NAMENODE -touchz "/a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names"

comparator.expected-output: ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names

test.description: ls: whitespaces in a relative path to a file

test-commands.command: -fs NAMENODE -touchz "a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names"

comparator.expected-output: ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names

test.description: ls: whitespaces in a scheme-qualified path to a file

test-commands.command: -fs NAMENODE -touchz "NAMENODE/a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names"

comparator.expected-output: ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*NAMENODE/a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names

test.description: ls: whitespaces in an absolute path to a file, using globbing

test-commands.command: -fs NAMENODE -touchz "/a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names"
-fs NAMENODE -touchz "/a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names 2"

comparator.expected-output: ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names
^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names 2

comparator.expected-output: ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names
^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names 2

test.description: ls: whitespaces in a scheme-qualified path to a file, using globbing

comparator.expected-output: ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*NAMENODE/a path with/whitespaces in directories/and file names

tests.test:
mv: file (absolute path) to file (absolute path)
-fs NAMENODE -touchz /file1 -fs NAMENODE -mv /file1 /file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls /file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm /file2 :
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file2
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file[^1]

test.description: mv: file (absolute path) to file (relative path)
mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); keep the same name at the destination
mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); keep the same name at the destination [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: `/file1': No such file or directory

test.description: mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); change the name at the destination
mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); change the name at the destination [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: `/file1': No such file or directory

test.description: mv: files (absolute path) to directory (absolute path) using globbing
mv: files (absolute path) to directory (absolute path) using globbing [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: `/file*': No such file or directory

test.description: mv: file (relative) to file (relative)

tests.test:
mv: moving file to file(rename in for hdfs:// path)
-fs NAMENODE -touchz hdfs:///file1 -fs NAMENODE -mv hdfs:///file1 hdfs:///file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls hdfs:///file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm hdfs:///file2 :
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*hdfs:///file2
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*hdfs:///file[^1]

test.description: mv: moving file to directory (keep the same name at the destination) in hdfs:// path -
mv: moving files to directory in hdfs:// path - [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: `hdfs:///file*': No such file or directory

test.description: mv: moving file that does not exist in hdfs:// path

comparator.expected-output: mv: `hdfs:///file1': No such file or directory

test.description: mv: moving file to directory (different name at the destination) in hdfs:// path
mv: moving file to directory (different name at the destination) in hdfs:// path [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: `hdfs:///file1': No such file or directory

test.description: mv: moving group of files to directory using globbing in hdfs:// path -
mv: moving files to directory using globbing in hdfs:// [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: `hdfs:///file*': No such file or directory

tests.test:
mv: moving file to file(rename) in Namenode's path -
-fs NAMENODE -touchz NAMENODE/file1 -fs NAMENODE -mv NAMENODE/file1 NAMENODE/file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls NAMENODE/file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm NAMENODE/file2 :
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*NAMENODE/file2
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*NAMENODE/file[^1]

cp: file (absolute path) to file (absolute path)
-fs NAMENODE -touchz /file1 -fs NAMENODE -cp /file1 /file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls /file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm /file* :
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*USERNAME( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file1

tests.test:
cp: copying non existent file (absolute path)
-fs NAMENODE -cp /file /file1
-fs NAMENODE -rm -r /user :
RegexpComparator ^cp: `/file': No such file or directory

cp: copying non existent file (relative path)
-fs NAMENODE -cp touchz test -fs NAMENODE -cp file1 file2
-fs NAMENODE -rm -r /user :
RegexpComparator ^cp: `file2': No such file or directory: `NAMENODE/user/USERNAME/file2'

test.description: cp: files to an existent file using globbing
cp: files to an existent file without globbing
cp: files to a non existent directory using globbing
cp: files to a non existent directory without globbing

-fs NAMENODE -rm hdfs:///file* :

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin report
help: help for dfsadmin safemode

comparator.expected-output: ^( |\t)*Safe mode is a Namenode state in which it( )*
^( |\t)*1.( )*does not accept changes to the name space \(read-only\)( )*
^( |\t)*Safe mode is entered automatically at Namenode startup, and( )*
^( |\t)*leaves safe mode automatically when the configured minimum( )*
^( |\t)*percentage of blocks satisfies the minimum replication( )*
^( |\t)*condition. Safe mode can also be entered manually, but then( )*
^( |\t)*it can only be turned off manually as well.( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin refreshNodes

comparator.expected-output: ^-refreshNodes:( |\t)*Updates the namenode with the set of datanodes allowed to connect to the namenode.( )*
^( |\t)*Namenode re-reads datanode hostnames from the file defined by( )*
^( |\t)*Hosts defined in dfs.hosts are the datanodes that are part of( )*
^( |\t)*the cluster. If there are entries in dfs.hosts, only the hosts( )*
^( |\t)*in it are allowed to register with the namenode.( )*
^( |\t)*Entries in dfs.hosts.exclude are datanodes that need to be( )*
^( |\t)*all the replicas from them are replicated to other datanodes.( )*
^( |\t)*Decommissioned nodes are not automatically shutdown and( )*
^( |\t)*are not chosen for writing new replicas.( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin finalizeUpgrade

comparator.expected-output: ^( |\t)*Datanodes delete their previous version working directories,( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin metasave

comparator.expected-output: ^( |\t)*to <filename> in the directory specified by hadoop.log.dir property.( )*
^( |\t)*<filename> will contain one line for each of the following( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin setQuota

comparator.expected-output: ^-setQuota <quota> <dirname>...<dirname>: Set the quota <quota> for each directory <dirName>.( )*
^( |\t)*The directory quota is a long integer that puts a hard limit( )*
^( |\t)*on the number of names in the directory tree( )*
^( |\t)*For each directory, attempt to set the quota. An error will be reported if( )*
^( |\t)*1. quota is not a positive integer, or( )*
^( |\t)*2. User is not an administrator, or( )*
^( |\t)*3. The directory does not exist or is a file.( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin clrQuota

comparator.expected-output: ^-clrQuota <dirname>...<dirname>: Clear the quota for each directory <dirName>.( )*
^( |\t)*For each directory, attempt to clear the quota. An error will be reported if( )*
^( |\t)*1. the directory does not exist or is a file, or( )*
^( |\t)*It does not fault if the directory has no quota.( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin setSpaceQuota

comparator.expected-output: ^-setSpaceQuota <quota> \[-storageType <storagetype>\] <dirname>...<dirname>: Set the space quota <quota> for each directory <dirName>.( )*
^( |\t)*The space quota is a long integer that puts a hard limit( )*
^( |\t)*on the total size of all the files under the directory tree.( )*
^( |\t)*2. user is not an administrator, or( )*
^( |\t)*3. the directory does not exist or is a file.( )*
^( |\t)*The storage type specific quota is set when -storageType option is specified.( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin clrSpaceQuota

comparator.expected-output: ^-clrSpaceQuota \[-storageType <storagetype>\] <dirname>...<dirname>: Clear the space quota for each directory <dirName>.( )*
^( |\t)*For each directory, attempt to clear the quota. An error will be reported if( )*
^( |\t)*1. the directory does not exist or is a file, or( )*
^( |\t)*It does not fault if the directory has no quota.( )*
^( |\t)*The storage type specific quota is cleared when -storageType option is specified.( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin refreshServiceAcl

comparator.expected-output: ^-refreshServiceAcl: Reload the service-level authorization policy file( )*
^( |\t)*Namenode will reload the authorization policy file.( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin help

comparator.expected-output: ^-help \[cmd\]:( |\t)*Displays help for the given command or all commands if none( )*

test.description: verifying error messages for quota commands - setting quota on a file
verifying error messages for quota commands - setting quota on non-existing file
verifying error messages for quota commands - exceeding quota

comparator.expected-output: The NameSpace quota (directories and files) of directory /test is exceeded

test.description: verifying error messages for quota commands - setting not valid quota
verifying error messages for quota commands - setting not valid space quota
